intro: Christia obcordata var. obcordata, commonly known as the heartleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like hibiscus and cotton. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
